00001 //
00002 //  ASINetworkQueue.h
00003 //  asi-http-request
00004 //
00005 //  Created by Ben Copsey on 07/11/2008.
00006 //  Copyright 2008-2009 All-Seeing Interactive. All rights reserved.
00007 //
00008 
00009 #import <Foundation/Foundation.h>
00010 
00011 @interface ASINetworkQueue : NSOperationQueue {
00012         
00013         // Delegate will get didFail + didFinish messages (if set)
00014         id delegate;
00015 
00016         // Will be called when a request completes with the request as the argument
00017         SEL requestDidFinishSelector;
00018         
00019         // Will be called when a request fails with the request as the argument
00020         SEL requestDidFailSelector;
00021         
00022         // Will be called when the queue finishes with the queue as the argument
00023         SEL queueDidFinishSelector;
00024         
00025         // Upload progress indicator, probably an NSProgressIndicator or UIProgressView
00026         id uploadProgressDelegate;
00027         
00028         // Total amount uploaded so far for all requests in this queue
00029         unsigned long long uploadProgressBytes;
00030         
00031         // Total amount to be uploaded for all requests in this queue - requests add to this figure as they work out how much data they have to transmit
00032         unsigned long long uploadProgressTotalBytes;
00033 
00034         // Download progress indicator, probably an NSProgressIndicator or UIProgressView
00035         id downloadProgressDelegate;
00036         
00037         // Total amount downloaded so far for all requests in this queue
00038         unsigned long long downloadProgressBytes;
00039         
00040         // Total amount to be downloaded for all requests in this queue - requests add to this figure as they receive Content-Length headers
00041         unsigned long long downloadProgressTotalBytes;
00042         
00043         // When YES, the queue will cancel all requests when a request fails. Default is YES
00044         BOOL shouldCancelAllRequestsOnFailure;
00045         
00046         //Number of real requests (excludes HEAD requests created to manage showAccurateProgress)
00047         int requestsCount;
00048         
00049         // When NO, this request will only update the progress indicator when it completes
00050         // When YES, this request will update the progress indicator according to how much data it has recieved so far
00051         // When YES, the queue will first perform HEAD requests for all GET requests in the queue, so it can calculate the total download size before it starts
00052         // NO means better performance, because it skips this step for GET requests, and it won't waste time updating the progress indicator until a request completes 
00053         // Set to YES if the size of a requests in the queue varies greatly for much more accurate results
00054         // Default for requests in the queue is NO
00055         BOOL showAccurateProgress;
00056 
00057         // Storage container for additional queue information.
00058         NSDictionary *userInfo;
00059 }
00060 
00061 // Convenience constructor
00062 + (id)queue;
00063 
00064 // Used internally to manage HEAD requests when showAccurateProgress is YES, do not use!
00065 - (void)addHEADOperation:(NSOperation *)operation;
00066 
00067 // Called at the start of a request to add on the size of this upload to the total
00068 - (void)incrementUploadSizeBy:(unsigned long long)bytes;
00069 
00070 // Called during a request when data is written to the upload stream to increment the progress indicator
00071 - (void)incrementUploadProgressBy:(unsigned long long)bytes;
00072 
00073 // Called at the start of a request to add on the size of this download to the total
00074 - (void)incrementDownloadSizeBy:(unsigned long long)bytes;
00075 
00076 // Called during a request when data is received to increment the progress indicator
00077 - (void)incrementDownloadProgressBy:(unsigned long long)bytes;
00078 
00079 // Called during a request when authorisation fails to cancel any progress so far
00080 - (void)decrementUploadProgressBy:(unsigned long long)bytes;
00081 
00082 // Called when the first chunk of data is written to the upload buffer
00083 // We ignore the first part chunk when tracking upload progress, as kCFStreamPropertyHTTPRequestBytesWrittenCount reports the amount of data written to the buffer, not the amount sent
00084 // This is to workaround the first 128KB of data appearing in an upload progress delegate immediately
00085 - (void)setUploadBufferSize:(unsigned long long)bytes;
00086 
00087 // All ASINetworkQueues are paused when created so that total size can be calculated before the queue starts
00088 // This method will start the queue
00089 - (void)go;
00090 
00091 // Used on iPhone platform to show / hide the network activity indicator (in the status bar)
00092 // On mac, you could subclass to do something else
00093 - (void)updateNetworkActivityIndicator;
00094 
00095 // Returns YES if the queue is in progress
00096 - (BOOL)isNetworkActive;
00097 
00098 
00099 @property (assign,setter=setUploadProgressDelegate:) id uploadProgressDelegate;
00100 @property (assign,setter=setDownloadProgressDelegate:) id downloadProgressDelegate;
00101 
00102 @property (assign) SEL requestDidFinishSelector;
00103 @property (assign) SEL requestDidFailSelector;
00104 @property (assign) SEL queueDidFinishSelector;
00105 @property (assign) BOOL shouldCancelAllRequestsOnFailure;
00106 @property (assign) id delegate;
00107 @property (assign) BOOL showAccurateProgress;
00108 @property (assign, readonly) int requestsCount;
00109 @property (retain) NSDictionary *userInfo;
00110 
00111 @end
